sources.name: Political Regime (OurWorldInData based on Polity IV and Wimmer & Min)
sources.description:
Data published by Our World In Data combined two datasets: Wimmer and Min (2006) for information on whether a country was colonized; Center for Systemic Peace for a measure of the political regime.
Colonial regime data Wimmer and Min (2006) – “From empire to nation-state: Explaining war in the modern world, 1816-2001”, American Sociological Review 71(6):867-897, 2006.
Democracy measure Polity 2 Measure that ranges from -10 (autocracy) to +10 (full democracy). This data is published by the Center for Systemic Peace
Dataset built by Max Roser on 3 August 2016
Polity 2 Measure ranges from -10 (autocracy) to +10 (full democracy). If a country was colonized in a given year is encoded as -20. In cases in which there was data from both Min and Wimmer and also Polity IV the Polity IV data is shown.

variables.name: Political Regime (OurWorldInData based on Polity IV and Wimmer & Min)
